message:
18-party imposes strike Wednesday
 
 The BNP (Bangladesh Nationalist Party)-led 18-aprty alliance has imposed a daylong shutdown across the country for Wednesday.
 
The decision came at a meeting of the high-profile leaders of the alliance Monday night.
 
The meeting – which began at 08:45pm at the BNP Chairperson’s Gulshan office in Dhaka – ended at 10:30pm.
 
Following the meeting, BNP standing committee member Dr Abdul Moin Khan came up with the announcement of the Wednesday’s shutdown.
 
The strike has been enforced demanding withdrawal of all cases against BNP Senior Vice-chairman Tarique Rahman, cancellation of ban on all sorts of meetings, rallies and public gatherings, restoration of caretaker government system and resignation of the ruling Awami League government.
